cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest late Sunday, then north-northwest across the western Caribbean, near or over western Cuba Monday night, and northward into the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s west coast mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or west-central Florida Gulf Coast (near the Tampa Bay to Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and entire Florida peninsula likely to experience heavy rain, gusty winds and coastal hazards mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (34–45 kt) possible late Tuesday night through Thursday as outer bands sweep across southeast Florida; peak probability 22%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (<3 ft) possible on the ocean-side mainly during onshore squalls, but significant surge threat remains on Florida’s Gulf coast, not Port Everglades.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized amounts up to 6 inches possible Tuesday–Thursday, producing urban and street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches.
